Regarding which musical artists have influenced him, Lecrae, in an interview with ''[[Essence (magazine)|Essence]]'', cited [[Tupac Shakur|Tupac]], [[Nas]], [[DJ Quik]], [[Scarface (rapper)|Scarface]], and [[The Cross Movement]].<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.essence.com/2011/05/22/lecrae-christian-rapper-hip-hop-reach-records-black-gospel/|title = 5 Questions for Lecrae on Christian Hip-Hop|date = May 22, 2011|accessdate = September 24, 2014|website = [[Essence (magazine)|Essence]]|publisher = Essence Communications|last = Jones|first = Gerald}}</ref> In an interview with ''[[The Christian Post]]'', Lecrae listed his top favorite five hip hop artists as Tupac, Nas, [[The Ambassador (rapper)|The Ambassador]], [[Snoop Dogg]], and, though for his business approach rather than his music, [[Jay Z]].<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.christianpost.com/news/lecrae-reveals-top-5-favorite-emcees-addresses-jay-z-and-the-illuminati-81128/|title = Lecrae Reveals Top 5 Favorite Emcees, Addresses Jay-Z and the Illuminati|date = September 5, 2012|accessdate = September 24, 2014|website = [[The Christian Post]]|publisher = The Christian Post Company|last = Funaro|first = Vincent}}</ref> Lecrae also names [[Outkast]] and [[Lauryn Hill]] as major influences, particularly their albums ''[[Aquemini]]'' and ''[[The Miseducation of Lauryn Hill]]'', respectively,<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://theboombox.com/lecrae-anomaly-interview-16-bars/|title = Lecrae Talks ‘Anomaly’ Album, Lauryn Hill and OutKast’s Influence & Freestyling for ’16 Bars’ [EXCLUSIVE VIDEO]|date = November 12, 2014|accessdate = December 3, 2014|website = The Boombox|last = Cline|first = Georgette}}</ref> and considers Hill's song "Adam Lives in Theory" as the top song that nourishes him spiritually.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.essence.com/2014/09/14/rapper-lecrae-faith-spirituality-and-why-lauryn-hill%E2%80%99s-music-inspires-him|title = Rapper LeCrae on Faith, Spirituality, and Why Lauryn Hill’s Music Inspires Him|date = September 12, 2014|accessdate = September 24, 2014|website = [[Essence (magazine)|Essence]]|publisher = Essence Communications|last = Sangweni|first = Yolanda}}</ref> In the song "Non-Fiction", he lists the [[Tunnel Rats (music group)|Tunnel Rats]] alongside The Cross Movement as an influence when he was newly converted to Christianity.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://buzz.eewmagazine.com/eew-magazine-buzz-blog/2014/9/10/lecrae-talks-overtly-sexual-entertainers-says-classy-women-n.html|title = Lecrae Talks Overtly Sexual Entertainers, Says ‘Classy’ Women Need Not ‘Advertise’|date = September 10, 2014|accessdate = September 24, 2014|website = Empowering Everyday Women|publisher = Empowering Everyday Women Ministries|last = DJ Walker}}</ref> Theologically, Lecrae follows the [[Calvinism|Reformed tradition]] of theology and is considered an influential figure in the [[New Calvinism|New Calvinist]] movement.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.desiringgod.org/conference-messages/the-new-calvinism-and-the-new-community|title = The New Calvinism and the New Community|date = March 12, 2014|accessdate = September 23, 2014|website = |publisher = Desiring God|last = Piper|first = John|authorlink = John Piper (theologian)}} </ref><ref>{{Cite book|title = A Call to Resurgence|last = Driscoll|first = Mark A.|publisher = [[Tyndale House]]|year = 2013|isbn = 9781414383620|location = [[Carol Stream, Illinois|Carol Stream]]|pages = 99, 201–202|url = https://books.google.com/books?id=XVD4AAAAQBAJ&printsec=frontcover#v=onepage&q&f=false|authorlink = Mark Driscoll}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Sun |first=Eryn |date=October 6, 2011 |title=Black Reformed Christians Under 'Theological Imperialism?' |url=http://m.christianpost.com/news/black-reformed-christians-under-theological-imperialism--57411/ |newspaper=[[The Christian Post]] |accessdate=September 18, 2014 }}</ref> He cites Tommy Nelson, [[John F. MacArthur|John MacArthur]], and [[John Piper (theologian)|John Piper]], among others, as early influences on his Christian faith, and Lecrae even titled one of his hit songs, "Don't Waste Your Life", after the book of the same name by Piper.<ref name=":2">{{cite web|url = http://www.bpnews.net/40684|title = Lecrae speaks of hip-hop's relevance|date = July 8, 2013|accessdate = September 24, 2014|website = [[Baptist Press]]|publisher = [[Southern Baptist Convention]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.challies.com/a-la-carte/john-pipers-unexpected-career-in-hip-hop|title = John Piper's Unexpected Career in Hip-Hop|date = February 10, 2012|accessdate = September 24, 2014|publisher = Tim Challies|last = Challies|first = Tim}}</ref> Lecrae explains that through Nelson, MacArthur, and Piper, he subsequently discovered [[Charles Spurgeon|Spurgeon]], [[John Calvin|Calvin]], and [[Francis Schaeffer]], the last of whom Lecrae calls his "personal hero".<ref name=":2" /> Other theologians cited by Lecrae include [[Tim Keller (pastor)|Tim Keller]], Andy Crouch, [[Randy Alcorn]], and [[Abraham Kuyper]].<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.christianitytoday.com/gleanings/2014/september/lecrae-brings-reformed-rap-jimmy-fallon-tonight-show.html|title = Lecrae Brings Reformed Rap to Jimmy Fallon’s Tonight Show|date = September 17, 2014|accessdate = September 24, 2014|website = [[Christianity Today]]|publisher = Christianity Today International|last = Shellnut|first = Kate}}</ref><ref name=":4">{{Cite web|url = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XXMfOsLARlc|title = Lecrae on his rap, theology and Billboard success|date = September 26, 2014|accessdate = October 6, 2014|website = religionnews1|publisher = YouTube|last = religionnews1}}</ref> He also looks to [[Martin Luther King, Jr.]] for inspiration on working out faith in social issues.<ref name=":4" />
He frequently tells the press that "My music is not Christian, Lecrae is."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.jconline.com/story/entertainment/music/2014/10/08/lecrae-music-christian-rapper/16850031/|title=Lecrae looks to break mold of a Christian rapper|publisher=|accessdate=March 15, 2018}}</ref> He told ''[[Miami New Times]]''{{'}}s Crossfade that "I think Christian is a wonderful noun, but a terrible adjective. Are there Christian shoes, Christian clothes, Christian plumbers, Christian pipes? I think if you're going to, you should label it hip-hop... hip-hop is a particular poetic style. Labeling it with the faith assumes that the song is going to be some kind of sermon, but there's a lot of social and political things that I don't think make it gospel or Christian music." He also stated, "I like to wrap my mind around a total situation. I'm a social anthropologist. If I never been homeless, let me try to be homeless for a week and soak up that information. More like a method actor. So for me it's spending time with people and talking about things from their perspective."<ref>Rolland, David. [http://blogs.miaminewtimes.com/crossfade/2014/11/lecrae_rapper_interview_anomaly_2014.php "Lecrae Discusses His Brand of Hip-Hop: 'I'm a Social Anthropologist'"] Crossfade. Miami New Times, November 10, 2014. Web. November 15, 2014.</ref>
==Popular culture== [[Brooklyn Nets]] guard [[Jeremy Lin]] recommended Lecrae and [[Hillsong United (band)|Hillsong]] in an interview when asked about his pre-game music.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://rapzilla.com/rz/news/38/4195 |title=Knicks Guard Jeremy Lin Recommends Lecrae |publisher=Rapzilla |date=February 15, 2012 |accessdate=March 1, 2012}}</ref> Former NFL quarterback [[Tim Tebow]] and professional wrestler [[Ezekiel Jackson]] have also endorsed Lecrae.<ref>{{cite web|last=Thomasos|first=Christine|title=Bubba Watson gives God the glory|url=http://www.christiantoday.com/article/bubba.watson.gives.god.the.glory/29658.htm|work=[[The Christian Post]]|publisher=The Christian Post Company|accessdate=August 7, 2012|date=April 12, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Horton|first=Chad|title=6 Reasons Why Lecrae Should've Won Dove Awards Artist of the Year|url=http://rapzilla.com/rz/features/story/4441-6-reasons-why-lecrae-should-win-dove-awards-artist-of-the-year|work=[[Rapzilla]]|accessdate=August 7, 2012|date=April 19, 2012}}</ref> During March 2014, Lecrae signed a ten-day contract with the [[Atlanta Hawks]], and on April 4, 2014, he performed live at [[Philips Arena]] after the Hawks game.<ref>{{cite web|last=Osicka|first=Luke|title=Grammy Winner Lecrae Tries NBA for Size|url=http://guardianlv.com/2014/03/grammy-winner-lecrae-tries-nba-for-size/|work=Guardian Liberty Voice|publisher=DiMarkco Chandler|accessdate=May 13, 2014|date=March 12, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Laxton|first=Mike|title=Lecrae To Perform After Atlanta Hawks Game On April 4 For Faith & Family Night|url=http://jamthehype.com/lecrae-perform-atlanta-hawks-game-april-4-faith-family-night/|work=Jam the Hype|publisher=Rain on Me Productions|accessdate=May 13, 2014|date=April 4, 2014}}</ref> "Dum Dum", a song by [[Tedashii]] featuring Lecrae, was used on an episode of ''[[So You Think You Can Dance]]''.<ref>{{cite web|last=O'Neil|first=Tyler|title='So You Think You Can Dance' Uses Christian Rap Song From Tedashii, Lecrae|url=http://www.christianpost.com/news/so-you-think-you-can-dance-uses-christian-rap-song-from-tedashii-lecrae-102908/|work=[[The Christian Post]]|publisher=The Christian Post Company|accessdate=May 13, 2014|date=August 23, 2013}}</ref> Lecrae also created the theme song for a new [[ESPN]] ''[[SportsCenter]]'' block called "Coast to Coast".<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.rapzilla.com/rz/news/38-backstage/14665-lecrae-creates-theme-song-for-espn-s-sportscenter|title=Lecrae creates theme song for ESPN's SportsCenter|last=Sarachik|first=Justin|newspaper=Rapzilla.com|access-date=January 27, 2017}}</ref>
==Social activism== [[File:Lecrae on fatherhood and sex trafficking.webm|left|thumb|Video in which Lecrae discusses the importance of fatherhood]] In 2011, 116 Clique and ReachLife Ministries, both headed by Lecrae, launched a media campaign entitled ''Man Up'', intended to mentor male urban youths on fatherhood and biblical manhood.<ref name=manup /> It features concert tours and a curriculum centered on a short film and a studio album, both titled ''Man Up'', and since 2012 has also featured a string of conference events.<ref name=manup />
In May 2013, Lecrae partnered with [[NBA]] player [[Dwyane Wade]], filmmaker Art Hooker, and [[Joshua DuBois]], the former head of the [[White House Office of Faith-Based and Neighborhood Partnerships|Office of Faith Based and Neighborhood Partnerships]] under the [[Presidency of Barack Obama|Obama administration]], to create the national media campaign ''This Is Fatherhood'', an initiative "devoted to restoring America's commitment to healthy fatherhood."<ref name=":1">{{cite web|url = http://www.wltx.com/news/watercooler/article/237346/363/Dwyane-Wade-Launches-Fatherhood-Challenge|title = Dwyane Wade & Hip-Hop Artist Lecrae Launch Fatherhood Challenge|last = Brown|first = Celeste|date = May 20, 2013|publisher = [[WLTX]]|accessdate = July 8, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = http://rapzilla.com/rz/news/1-press/6343-dwyane-wade-and-grammy-winning-artist-lecrae-join-forces-to-champion-fatherhood|title = Dwyane Wade and Grammy Winning Artist Lecrae Join Forces to Champion Fatherhood|last = Rapzilla|date = May 24, 2013|website = [[Rapzilla]]|publisher = Philip Rood and Chad Horton|accessdate = July 9, 2013}}</ref> The campaign began on May 1 with a "This is Fatherhood Challenge", in which contestants could submit videos, songs, and essays about fatherhood through June 10. The winners received cash prizes and a trip to Washington, D.C., for a ceremony on [[Father's Day]]. In addition, Lecrae offered studio time and mentoring to the grand prize winner.<ref name=":1" /> Lecrae, Wade, DuBois, [[Jay Z]], and U.S. President [[Barack Obama]] all made appearances in the campaign's promotional public service announcements.<ref name=":1" />
Lecrae has also contributed op-ed articles to ''Billboard'' dealing with [[Racism in the United States|race relations in the United States]], including the 2014 [[Ferguson unrest]], 2015 [[Charleston church shooting]], and 2016 shootings of [[Shooting of Alton Sterling|Alton Stirling]], [[Shooting of Philando Castile|Philando Castile]], and [[2016 shooting of Dallas police officers|six Dallas police officers]].<ref>{{Cite web|title = Lecrae on Ferguson: 'The System We Have in Place Has Biases'|url = http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/the-juice/6327837/lecrae-ferguson|accessdate = August 10, 2015|website = [[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|first = Lecrae|last = Moore}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title = Lecrae Op-Ed: Charleston Shooting Comes From Deeply Rooted Racism & Injustice|url = http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/the-juice/6605623/lecrae-charleston-shooting-op-ed|accessdate = August 10, 2015|website = [[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|last = Moore|first = Lecrae}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/hip-hop/7431179/lecrae-humility-race-relations|title=Lecrae: Humility is the Key to Understanding Race Relations: Guest Essay|newspaper=Billboard|access-date=October 24, 2016}}</ref> In these articles, Lecrae has called for understanding and empathy across racial divides and willingness to listen to the oppressed, and also pointed out the need for spiritual healing through Jesus Christ.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Lecrae Says Christians Should Build Relationships With People Whose Cultural Perspective Frustrates Them|url = http://www.christianpost.com/news/lecrae-says-christians-should-build-relationships-with-people-whose-cultural-perspective-frustrates-them-141901/|accessdate = August 10, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title = Lecrae Speaks Out on Michael Brown Verdict; Christians Should 'Empathize' With Ferguson, Finds Unsympathetic 'Churchianity' Hurtful [VIDEO]|url = http://www.breathecast.com/articles/rapper-lecrae-speaks-out-michael-browns-case-verdict-christians-empathize-ferguson-22068/|accessdate = August 10, 2015}}</ref> In mid 2016, Lecrae did a talk about racial reconciliation at [[Yale University]], titled "Knowledge through Narrative: Bridging the Racial Divide in America".<ref>{{cite web |url= http://timothydwight.yalecollege.yale.edu/news/notes-and-news-week-april-25-2016 |title= Notes and News - Week of April 25, 2016 |work= Timothy Dwight College |accessdate=July 11, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/hip-hop/7431179/lecrae-humility-race-relations |title= Lecrae: Humility is the Key to Understanding Race Relations: Guest Essay |work= Billboard |accessdate=July 11, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RNSyAYRUPlk |title= Knowledge Though Narrative: Bridging the Racial Divide in America--Lecrae Talk at Yale |work= Youtube |accessdate=July 11, 2017}}</ref> He also spoke on hip hop culture at a Nashville TEDx conference, decrying the misogyny and violence rampant in much of hip hop's lyrics but advocating for hip hop to be used as an agent for social change.<ref>{{Citation|last=TEDx Talks|title=Heroes and Villains: Is hip-hop a cancer or a cure? {{!}} Lecrae {{!}} TEDxNashville|date=May 17, 2016|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BFas9cd8ZZ8|accessdate=October 24, 2016}}</ref> At the [[2016 BET Hip Hop Awards]], Lecrae performed an original composition addressing racial injustice in the United States, referencing the shooting of Philando Castile.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.rapzilla.com/rz/news/38-backstage/14234-watch-lecrae-s-performance-at-the-2016-bet-hip-hop-awards|title=Watch Lecrae's performance at the 2016 BET Hip Hop Awards|last=Daniels|first=David|newspaper=Rapzilla|access-date=October 24, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/lecrae-bet-black-lives_us_57f678d6e4b0c1a524cbbc9b|title=Christian Rapper Lecrae Preaches On Racial Injustice At The BET Hip Hop Awards|last=Editor|first=Carol Kuruvilla Associate Religion|date=October 6, 2016|website=The Huffington Post|access-date=October 24, 2016}}</ref> On October 20, 2016, Lecrae wrote in [[The Huffington Post]] that he has been struggling with depression and doubt, which was partly caused by the backlash he received from many [[Evangelicalism|American evangelicals]] who are critical of his public stance on race-related issues.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/i-declare-black-lives-matter_us_5808be36e4b0dd54ce385412|title=The Pains Of Humanity Have Been Draining Me|last=Moore|first=Lecrae|date=October 20, 2016|website=The Huffington Post|access-date=October 24, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://rapzilla.com/rz/news/38-backstage/14325-lecrae-pens-open-letter-admits-he-hit-a-serious-low|title=Lecrae Pens Open Letter; Admits He 'Hit a Serious Low'|last=Sarachik|first=Justin|newspaper=Rapzilla|access-date=October 24, 2016}}</ref>
==Personal life== Lecrae currently resides in Atlanta since relocating there from Memphis in 2009, and is married to Darragh Moore. The couple has three children together.<ref name=familychristian /> Lecrae is a graduate of [[University of North Texas]]. In an interview with [[HipHopDX]], Lecrae stated that [[Clipse]] member [[No Malice]] sought him out as a spiritual advisor.<ref name="hiphopdx">{{cite web|last=Arnold|first=Paul W|title=Lecrae Clarifies His 'Gimme A Second' Line About Jay-Z & Lil Wayne, Details Spiritual Advisor Role To No Malice|url=http://www.hiphopdx.com/index/news/id.19706/title.lecrae-clarifies-his-gimme-a-second-line-about-jay-z-lil-wayne-details-spiritual-advisor-role-to-no-malice|work=Hip Hop DX|accessdate=September 15, 2012|date=May 11, 2012}}</ref>
[[Canada Christian College]] bestowed an honorary Doctorate of Music to Lecrae on March 14, 2016 while visiting Toronto, making him the youngest recipient of such a degree from the college.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Warmington|first1=Joe|title=Dr. Lecrae Comes to Town|url=http://www.torontosun.com/2016/03/11/scrawler-dr-lecrae-comes-to-town|work=Toronto Sun|accessdate=March 16, 2016}}</ref>

==Awards and nominations== {{Main|List of awards and nominations received by Lecrae}} Lecrae has won many music awards over the space of his career, including two Grammy Awards and seven Dove Awards. In 2013, he became the first hip hop artist to win the [[Grammy Award for Best Gospel Album]], which was awarded to his sixth album, ''[[Gravity (Lecrae album)|Gravity]]'',<ref>{{cite web|last1 = Paine|first1 = Jake|title = Lecrae The First Rapper To Win A Gospel Grammy Award|url = http://www.hiphopdx.com/index/news/id.22880/title.lecrae-the-first-rapper-to-win-a-gospel-grammy-award|website = [[Hip Hop DX]]|accessdate = March 24, 2015|date = February 11, 2013}}</ref> and in 2015 became the first rapper to win the [[BET Award for Best Gospel Artist]].<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.christianpost.com/news/lecrae-becomes-first-rapper-to-win-best-gospel-artist-bet-award-141022/|title = Lecrae Becomes First Rapper to Win Best Gospel Artist BET Award|date = June 30, 2015|accessdate = August 11, 2015|website = [[The Christian Post]]|publisher = The Christian Post Company|last = Funaro|first = Vincent}}</ref>

page.title: List of Eastern Orthodox universities and colleges in the United States

revision.text:
There are several Eastern Orthodox colleges and universities in the United States. There are also a number of distance education programs affiliated with Eastern Orthodox churches in North America, and blended residency and online certification programs in theology or ministry.<ref>{{cite web | title=St. Stephen's Certificate Program - Antiochian Orthodox Christian Archdiocese | url=http://www.antiochian.org/studies/st-stephens-certificate-program}}</ref>
Orthodox education has existed in [[North America]] since Russian colonization of Alaska in the late 18th Century, but has only existed in the [[United States]] since the early 20th Century.<ref>{{cite web | title=Our History - St. Vladimir's Orthodox Seminary | url=http://www.svots.edu/our-history}}</ref>
==Accreditation==
Accreditation of Orthodox institutes of higher learning in the United States is not uniform. Saint Herman's Orthodox Seminary of Alaska lost its accreditation as an institution of higher education in the 1990s, and now works under state authorization as an exempted religious institution.<ref>{{cite web | title= Saint Herman Theological Seminary - About Us | url=http://www.sthermanseminary.org/about.html}}</ref>
*[[St. Herman's Orthodox Theological Seminary (Kodiak, Alaska)|Saint Herman's Orthodox Theological Seminary]] - Kodiak, Alaska; Diocese of Alaska, in The [[Orthodox Church in America]]. *[http://www.orthodoxinstitute.org/ The Patriarch Athenagoras Orthodox Institute] - Berkeley, California *[http://www.antiochian.org/academy St. Athanasius Academy of Orthodox Theology] - Elk Grove, California; [[Antiochian Orthodox Christian Archdiocese of North America]]. *[http://serborth.org/education.html St. Sava's Serbian Orthodox Seminary] - Libertyville, Illinois *[[Holy Cross Greek Orthodox School of Theology (Brookline, Massachusetts)|Holy Cross Greek Orthodox School of Theology]] - Brookline, Massachusetts; [[Greek Orthodox Archdiocese of America]]. *[[St. Sophia Ukrainian Orthodox Theological Seminary (South Bound Brook, New Jersey)|St. Sophia Ukrainian Orthodox Theological Seminary]] - South Bound Brook, New Jersey *[[St. Vladimir's Orthodox Theological Seminary (Crestwood, New York)|Saint Vladimir's Orthodox Theological Seminary]] - Crestwood, New York; [[Orthodox Church in America]] *[[Holy Trinity Orthodox Seminary (Jordanville, New York)|Holy Trinity Orthodox Seminary]] - Jordanville, New York; [[Russian Orthodox Church Outside Russia]] *[[Christ the Saviour Seminary (Johnstown, Pennsylvania)|Christ the Saviour Carpatho-Russian Seminary]] - Johnstown, Pennsylvania; [[American Carpatho-Russian Orthodox Diocese]] *[[St. Tikhon's Orthodox Theological Seminary (South Canaan, Pennsylvania)|Saint Tikhon's Orthodox Theological Seminary]] - South Canaan, Pennsylvania; The [[Orthodox Church in America]] *[https://www.spots.school/ St. Photios Orthodox Theological Seminary] - Etna, California *[http://www.usk.edu University of Saint Katherine] - San Marcos, California
==Distance Education== *[http://www.orthodoxtheologicalinstitute.org St. Gregory Nazianzen Orthodox Theological Institute - Ecumenical Patriarchate] *[http://www.euclidconsortium.org/euclid/en/school-pf.asp The Pavel Florensky School of Theology and Ministry] - An academic unit within the Euclid University Consortium. The Master's Degree in Orthodox Theology and Doctoral / Ph.D. programs are administered by a priest of the [[Ukrainian Orthodox Church of the USA]] (Patriarchate of Constantinople). *[http://www.orthodoxtheologicalschool.org/ The Pastoral School of the Diocese of Chicago and Mid-America of the Russian Orthodox Church Outside of Russia] offers diplomas in Pastoral Theology and Orthodox Studies. *St. Stephen's Course in Orthodox Theology - [[Antiochian Orthodox Christian Archdiocese of North America]] *[http://www.svots.edu/doctor-ministry-d-min St. Vladimir's Orthodox Theological Seminary - D. Min. Degree] *[http://www.hts.edu/seminary/front/en/academics.html#6 Holy Trinity Orthodox Seminary] of the Russian Orthodox Church Outside of Russia in Jordanville, NY, offers a four semester course of study leading to a Certificate in Theological Studies.

{{Infobox saint |image = Trino Chiesa San Domenico Beata Panattieri.JPG |imagesize = |caption = |name = [[Beatification|Blessed]]
Maddalena Panattieri
[[Order of Preachers|O.P.]] |birth_date = 1443 |birth_place = [[Trino]], [[Vercelli]], [[Duchy of Savoy]] |death_date = 13 October 1503 (aged 60) |death_place = Trino, Vercelli, Duchy of Savoy |titles = Religious |major_shrine = |resting_place = |venerated_in = [[Roman Catholic Church]] |feast_day = 13 October |attributes = {{unbulleted list|Dominican habit|Heart|[[Rosary]]|[[Crown of thorns]]}} |patronage = {{unbulleted list|Trino|Catechists}} |beatified_date = 26 September 1827 |beatified_place = [[Saint Peter's Basilica]], [[Papal States]] |beatified_by = [[Pope Leo XII]] |canonized_date = |canonized_place = |canonized_by = }} [[Beatification|Blessed]] '''Maddalena Panattieri''' (1443 – 13 October 1503) was an [[Italian people|Italian]] [[Roman Catholic Church|Roman Catholic]] [[Nun|professed religious]] and a professed member of the [[Order of Preachers|Sisters of Penance of Saint Dominic]] since her late adolescence.{{cite web|url=http://catholicsaints.info/blessed-magdalen-panattieri/|title=Blessed Magdalen Panattieri|publisher=Saints SQPN|date=28 July 2015|accessdate=31 July 2016}} Panattieri was a [[Stigmata|stigmatic]] and received visions during her life with one in particular being the French invasion of the Italian peninsula.{{cite web|url=http://catholicfire.blogspot.com.au/2012/10/blessed-magdalen-panattieri.html|title=Blessed Magdalen Panattieri|date=13 October 2012|publisher=Catholic Fire|accessdate=31 July 2016}} She served as a [[Catechism|catechist]] to children and was noted for her simple existence.{{cite web|url=http://orderofpreachersindependent.org/2014/10/12/blessed-magdalen-dei-panattieri/|title=Blessed Magdalen dei Panattieri|date=12 October 2014|publisher=The Order of Preachers, Independent|accessdate=31 July 2016}} Panattieri was beatified on 26 September 1897 after [[Pope Leo XII]] confirmed that there was a longstanding 'cultus' (or popular devotion) to the late religious.{{cite web|url=http://www.santiebeati.it/dettaglio/90480|title=Blessed Maddalena Panattieri|date=|publisher=Santi e Beati|accessdate=31 July 2016}} ==Life== Maddalena Panattieri was born in [[Trino]] in 1443 and as a child fostered a great devotion to [[Catherine of Siena|Saint Catherine of Siena]]. She joined the [[Order of Preachers]] not long before 1463 as part of the tertiaries rather than as a formal religious; this was considered unusual since members were mainly widows and older women. She made a private vow as a child to remain [[Chastity|chaste]]. Panattieri lived at home alongside her relations and devoted her time to the care of both the poor and the ill and she would often give talks to children (she was quite fond of children) while later speaking with [[priests]] and [[nuns]]. She would instruct these children in [[catechism]] which led to older people flocking to hear her speak on the subject. Panattieri also received the [[stigmata]] later in life though kept this a secret. The reform movement of [[Raymond of Capua|Blessed Raimondo da Capua]] of the order saw the religious promote it in Trino. [[God]] also revealed to her the coming French invasion of the Italian peninsula though she would not live to see it. She often spent her mornings in [[Eucharistic Adoration]] while her afternoons saw her administering to both the ill and the poor; she became noted for her austerities which included wearing a rough woolen shirt and for her long fasts. When her brother kept getting into trouble (and his conduct exceeded all patience) she would fall to her knees before a [[Crucifix]] and would beg for God to intervene and help her brother. Through her efforts the order was inspired to undertake a more strict observance which led to [[Sebastian Maggi|Blessed Sebastiano Maggi]] - from [[Milan]] - coming in 1490 to inaugurate this at her request. On one occasion a rich councilor from Milan - who harbored great hatred towards the faith - was [[Excommunication|excommunicated]] and he hit her across the face in public and called her names. She dropped to her knees and said: "Brother here is the other cheek. I give it to you in love of [[Jesus Christ]]" which infuriated the man further. But justice was too late for the man died a violent death from a painful and incurable disease not long after this incident. Panattieri died on 13 October 1503 in Trino. On her deathbed she said: "I could not be happy in Heaven if you were not there too" to those assembled near her bedside. She sang "Jesus our Redeemer" and the "Ave Maria" prior to her death. Her remains were found in 1964 and transferred in 1970. ==Beatification== Panattieri received formal beatification from [[Pope Leo XII]] on 26 September 1827 once the pontiff confirmed that a 'cultus' (or popular devotion) to Panattieri existed and endured since her death. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://catholicsaints.info/blessed-magdalen-panattieri/ Saints SQPN] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Panattieri, Maddalena}} [[Category:1443 births]] [[Category:1503 deaths]] [[Category:15th-century venerated Christians]] [[Category:15th-century Roman Catholics]] [[Category:15th-century Italian people]] [[Category:16th-century venerated Christians]] [[Category:16th-century Roman Catholics]] [[Category:16th-century Italian people]] [[Category:Dominican beatified people]] [[Category:Italian nuns]] [[Category:Italian beatified people]] [[Category:Italian Roman Catholics]] [[Category:Italian Roman Catholic religious sisters and nuns]] [[Category:Members of the Dominican Order]] [[Category:People from Vercelli]] [[Category:Stigmatics]] [[Category:Venerated Catholics]] [[Category:Venerated Dominicans]]

{{other uses}} {{EngvarB|date=August 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2014}} {{Infobox religious biography |religion = [[Hinduism]] |name = Meera |other_names = {{ubl|Mirabai|Meera Bai}} |image = Meerabai painting.jpg |caption = A painting of Meera Bai |birth_date = 1498 CE<ref name=ushamiralife>Usha Nilsson (1997), Mira bai, Sahitya Akademi, {{ISBN|978-8126004119}}, pages 1-15</ref> |birth_place = Kurki, district Pali, [[Rajasthan]], [[Jodhpur State]],Rajasthan Marwar |death_date = [[Mughal empire]] 1546 CE(aged 47-48)<ref name=ushamiralife/> |known_for = Poet [[Bhakti movement]], [[Vaishnavism]] (Krishna) }} {{Vaishnavism}} '''Meera''', also known as '''Meera Bai''' or '''Mirabai'''<ref name=brit1>{{cite web|title=Mira Bai|url=http://www.britannica.com/biography/Mira-Bai|publisher=Encyclopædia Britannica }}</ref> (1498-1546) was a [[Hindu]] [[Mysticism|mystic]] poet of the Bhakti movement. She referred to the Lord, whom she saw as her husband, with different names like Satguru, Prabhu Ji, Girdhar Nagar, Krishna. She even called him the husband of her soul. Due to her mother, her in-laws disapproved of her public singing and dancing as she belonged to a Royal Family of Mewar and was a princess. But she had too much love for her god and sacrificed everything, even her family, for god and attained Moksha through [[Bhakti Yoga]]. She is a celebrated [[Bhakti movement|Bhakti]] saint, particularly in the North Indian Hindu tradition.<ref>Karen Pechelis (2004), The Graceful Guru, Oxford University Press, {{ISBN|978-0195145373}}, pages 21-23, 29-30</ref><ref>Neeti Sadarangani (2004), Bhakti Poetry in Medieval India: Its Inception, Cultural Encounter and Impact, Sarup & Sons, {{ISBN|978-8176254366}}, pages 76-80</ref>
Meera Bai was born into family of Merta, [[Rajasthan]], India. She is mentioned in [[Bhaktamal]], confirming that she was widely known and a cherished figure in the [[Bhakti movement]] culture by about 1600 CE.<ref name=asher>Catherine Asher and Cynthia Talbot (2006), India before Europe, Cambridge University Press, {{ISBN|978-0521809047}}, page 109</ref> Most legends about Meera mention her fearless disregard for social and family conventions, her devotion to Lord Krishna, her treating Krishna as her husband, and she being persecuted by her [[in-law]]s for her religious devotion.<ref name=ushamiralife/><ref name=asher/> She has been the subject of numerous folk tales and [[hagiography|hagiographic]] legends, which are inconsistent or widely different in details.<ref name=ushamiralife/><ref name=nancy>Nancy Martin-Kershaw (2014), Faces of the Feminine in Ancient, Medieval, and Modern India (Editor: Mandakranta Bose), Oxford University Press, {{ISBN|978-0195352771}}, pages 162-178</ref> Thousands of devotional poems in passionate praise of Lord [[Krishna]] are attributed to Meera in the Indian tradition, but just a few hundred are believed to be authentic by scholars, and the earliest written records suggest that except for two poems, most were written down only in the 18th century.<ref name=hawley>John Stratton Hawley (2002), Asceticism (Editors: Vincent Wimbush, Richard Valantasi), Oxford University Press, {{ISBN|978-0195151381}}, pages 301-302</ref> Many poems attributed to Meera were likely composed later by others who admired Meera. These poems are commonly known as ''[[bhajan]]s'', and are popular across India.<ref>Edwin Bryant (2007), Krishna: A Sourcebook, Oxford University Press, {{ISBN|978-0195148923}}, page 254</ref> Hindu temples, such as in Chittorgarh fort, are dedicated to Mira Bai's memory.<ref name=ushamiralife/> Legends about Meera's life, of contested authenticity, have been the subject of movies, comic strips and other popular literature in modern times.<ref>Edwin Bryant (2007), Krishna: A Sourcebook, Oxford University Press, {{ISBN|978-0195148923}}, page 242</ref>
==Biography== [[File:Rajasthan-Chittore Garh 09.jpg|left|230px|thumb|''Meera's'' temple to [[Krishna]] at [[Chittor Fort]], Rajasthan]] Authentic records about Meera are not available, and scholars have attempted to establish Meera's biography from secondary literature that mention her, and wherein dates and other moments. Meera unwillingly married [[Bhoj Raj]], the crown prince of [[Mewar]], in 1516.<ref name=usha13>Usha Nilsson (1997), Mira bai, Sahitya Akademi, {{ISBN|978-8126004119}}, pages 12-13</ref><ref>Nancy Martin-Kershaw (2014), Faces of the Feminine in Ancient, Medieval, and Modern India (Editor: Mandakranta Bose), Oxford University Press, {{ISBN|978-0195352771}}, page 165</ref> Her husband was wounded in one of the ongoing Hindu-Muslim wars of the [[Delhi Sultanate]] in 1518, and he died of battle wounds in 1521. Both her own father and her father-in-law were killed within a few years after her husband,<ref name=ushamiralife/> during a war with the Islamic army of Babur – the founder of [[Mughal Empire]] in the Indian subcontinent.<ref name=kinsley>David Kinsley (1997), Tradition and Modernity in Bhakti Movements (Editor: J Lele), Brill Academic, {{ISBN|978-9004063709}}, pages 88-89</ref><ref>SR Bakshi (2002), Mirabai: Saints of India, Criterion, {{ISBN|978-8179380239}}, pages 42-45, 282-283</ref>
After the death of her father-in-law, Vikram Singh became the ruler of Mewar. According to a popular legend, her in-laws tried many times to execute her, such as sending Meera a glass of poison and telling her it was nectar or sending her a basket with a snake instead of flowers.<ref name=brit1/><ref name=usha13/> According to the hagiographic legends, she was not harmed in either case, with the snake miraculously becoming a Krishna idol (or a garland of flowers depending on the version).<ref name=nancy/><ref name=usha13/> In another version of these legends, she is asked by Vikram Singh to go drown herself, which she tries but she finds herself floating on water.<ref name=usha17>Usha Nilsson (1997), Mira bai, Sahitya Akademi, {{ISBN|978-8126004119}}, pages 16-17</ref> Yet another legend states that the Mughal emperor [[Akbar]] came with [[Tansen]] to visit Meera and presented a pearl necklace, but scholars doubt this ever happened because Tansen joined Akbar's court in 1562, 15 years after she died.<ref name=usha17/> Similarly, some stories state that [[Raidas]] was her guru (teacher), but there is no corroborating historical evidence for this and the difference of over 100 years in the birth years for Ravidas and Meera suggest this to be unlikely.<ref name=usha17/>
The three different oldest records known as of 2014 that mention Meera,<ref>These are Munhata Nainsi's Khyat from [[Jodhpur]], Prem Ambodh from [[Amritsar]] and Nabhadas's Chappay from [[Varanasi]]; see: JS Hawley and GS Mann (2014), Culture and Circulation: Literature in Motion in Early Modern India (Editors: Thomas De Bruijn and Allison Busch), Brill Academic, {{ISBN|978-9004264472}}, pages 131-135</ref> all from the 17th century and written within 150 years of Meera's death, neither mention anything about her childhood or circumstances of her marriage to Bhojraj, nor do they mention that the people who persecuted her were her in-laws or from some Rajput royal family.<ref>JS Hawley and GS Mann (2014), Culture and Circulation: Literature in Motion in Early Modern India (Editors: Thomas De Bruijn and Allison Busch), Brill Academic, {{ISBN|978-9004264472}}, pages 131-135</ref> Nancy Martin-Kershaw states that to the extent Meera was challenged and persecuted, religious or social conventions were unlikely to have been the cause, rather the likely cause were political chaos and military conflicts between the Rajput kingdom and the Mughal Empire.
Other stories state that Mira Bai left the kingdom of Mewar and went on pilgrimages. In her last years, Meera lived in [[Dwarka]] or [[Vrindavan]], where legends state she miraculously disappeared by merging into an idol of Krishna in 1547.<ref name=ushamiralife/><ref name=brit1/> While miracles are contested by scholars for the lack of historical evidence, it is widely acknowledged that Meera dedicated her life to Hindu deity Krishna, composing songs of devotion and was one of the most important poet-saint of the Bhakti movement period.<ref name=brit1/><ref name=usha17/><ref>John S Hawley (2005), Three Bhakti Voices: Mirabai, Surdas and Kabir in Their Times and Ours, Oxford University Press, {{ISBN|978-0195670851}}, pages 128-130</ref>
==Poetry== [[File:Krishna N Radha.jpg|thumb|230px|Most of Meera's poems are dedicated to God in the form of Krishna (left), calling him the Dark One or the Mountain Lifter. Some Meera songs include Radha (right), the mythical lover of Krishna. Al lher poems have philosophical connotations.<ref>Edwin Bryant (2007), Krishna: A Sourcebook, Oxford University Press, {{ISBN|978-0195148923}}, page 244</ref>]] [[File:Meera.png|alt=OM|thumb|341x341px|MEERA BAI]] A number of compositions by Meera Bai continue to be sung today in India, mostly as devotional songs (''bhajans'') though nearly all of them have a philosophical connotation.<ref>{{cite book |last1=Subramanian |first1=VK |title=Mystic songs of Meera (in Hindi and English) |date=1 February 2005 |publisher=Abhinav publications |isbn=8170174589 |url=https://www.exoticindiaart.com/book/details/mystic-songs-of-meera-with-english-transliteration-and-translation-IDF197/ |accessdate=23 November 2018}}</ref> One of her most popular compositions remains "''Paayoji maine Ram Ratan dhan paayo''" (पायो जी मैंने राम रतन धन पायो। ).<ref>{{cite web |title=Lyrics - Ram Ratan Dhan Paayo (Lata Mangeshkar rendition) |url=http://tophindilyrics.com/shri-ram-bhajan/%e0%a4%aa%e0%a4%be%e0%a4%af%e0%a5%8b-%e0%a4%9c%e0%a5%80-%e0%a4%ae%e0%a5%88%e0%a4%82%e0%a4%a8%e0%a5%87-%e0%a4%b0%e0%a4%be%e0%a4%ae-%e0%a4%b0%e0%a4%a4%e0%a4%a8-%e0%a4%a7%e0%a4%a8-%e0%a4%aa%e0%a4%be/ |website=www.tophindilyrics.com |publisher=Top Hindi Lyrics |accessdate=23 November 2018}}</ref> <ref>{{cite book |title=The poetry of Meera : a compendium of her songs translated in English |publisher=Poetry Hunter |url=https://www.poemhunter.com/i/ebooks/pdf/mirabai_2012_7.pdf |accessdate=23 November 2018}}</ref> Meera's poems are lyrical ''padas'' (metric verses) in [[Rajasthani language|Rajasthani]] language.<ref name=usha17/> While thousands of verses are attributed to her, scholars are divided in their opinion as to how many of them were actually penned by Meera herself.<ref>{{cite web |title=Meera ke bhajan (Hindi) |url=https://hindividya.com/mirabai-poems/ |website=www.hindividya.com |publisher=Hindi Vidya |accessdate=23 November 2018}}</ref> There are no surviving manuscripts of her poetry from her time, and the earliest records with two poems credited to her are from early 18th-century, more than 150 years after she died.<ref name="hawley" />
===Hindi and Rajasthani=== The largest collection of poems credited to her are in 19th-century manuscripts. Scholars have attempted to establish authenticity based on both the poem and Meera being mentioned in other manuscripts as well as from style, linguistics and form.<ref name="hawley" /><ref name="edwinsongs">Edwin Bryant (2007), Krishna: A Sourcebook, Oxford University Press, {{ISBN|978-0195148923}}, pages 244-245</ref> John Stratton Hawley cautions, "When one speaks of the poetry of Mirabai, then, there is always an element of enigma. (...) there must always remain a question about whether there is any real relation between the poems we cite and a historical Mira."<ref>John Stratton Hawley (2002), Asceticism (Editors: Vincent Wimbush, Richard Valantasi), Oxford University Press, {{ISBN|978-0195151381}}, page 302</ref>
In her poems, Krishna is a yogi and lover, and she herself is a yogini ready to take her place by his side into a spiritual marital bliss.<ref name=hawley/> Meera's style combines impassioned mood, defiance, longing, anticipation, joy and ecstasy of union, always centered on Krishna.<ref name=edwinsongs/>
{{Quote| <poem> My [[Krishna|Dark One]] has gone to an alien land. He has left me behind, he's never returned, he's never sent me a single word. So I've stripped off my ornaments, jewels and adornments, cut my hair from my head. And put on holy garments, all on his account, seeking him in all four directions. Mira: unless she meets the Dark One, her Lord, she doesn't even want to live. </poem> |Mira Bai|Translated by John Stratton Hawley<ref>John Stratton Hawley (2002), Asceticism (Editors: Vincent Wimbush, Richard Valantasi), Oxford University Press, {{ISBN|978-0195151381}}, page 303</ref>}}
Meera speaks of a personal relationship with Krishna as her lover, lord and mountain lifter. The characteristic of her poetry is complete surrender.
{{Quote| <poem> After making me fall for you so hard, where are you going? Until the day I see you, no repose: my life, like a fish washed on shore, flails in agony. For your sake I'll make myself a yogini, I'll hurl myself to death on the saw of Kashi. Mira's Lord is the clever Mountain Lifter, and I am his, a slave to his lotus feet. </poem> |Mira Bai|Translated by John Stratton Hawley<ref>John Stratton Hawley (2002), Asceticism (Editors: Vincent Wimbush, Richard Valantasi), Oxford University Press, {{ISBN|978-0195151381}}, page 304</ref>}}
Meera is often classed with the northern Sant bhaktis who spoke of a [[Nirguna brahman|formless]] divinity.<ref name="Hinduism 1996, Page 144">''An Introduction to Hinduism'', Cambridge 1996, Page 144, by Gavin Flood</ref>
===Sikh literature=== ''Prem Ambodh Pothi'', a text attributed to [[Guru Gobind Singh]] and completed in 1693 CE, includes poetry of Mira Bai as one of sixteen historic ''bhakti sants'' important to Sikhism.<ref>JS Hawley and GS Mann (2014), Culture and Circulation: Literature in Motion in Early Modern India (Editors: Thomas De Bruijn and Allison Busch), Brill Academic, {{ISBN|978-9004264472}}, pages 113-136</ref>
==Influence== {{Hinduism}} Scholars acknowledge that Meera was one of the central poet-saints of the Bhakti movement, during a difficult period in Indian history filled with religious conflicts. Yet, they simultaneously question the extent to which Meera was a canonical projection of social imagination that followed, where she became a symbol of people's suffering and a desire for an alternative.<ref name=dirkparita>Dirk Wiemann (2008), Genres of Modernity: Contemporary Indian Novels in English, Rodopi, {{ISBN|978-9042024939}}, pages 148-149</ref> Dirk Wiemann, quoting Parita Mukta, states,
{{Quote| If one accepts that someone very akin to the Mira legend [about persecution and her devotion] existed as an actual social being, the power of her convictions broke the brutal feudal relationships that existed at that time. The Mira Bai of the popular imagination, then, is an intensely [[Anachronism|anachronistic]] figure by virtue of that anticipatory radical democracy which propels Meera out of the [[historicity]] that remains nonetheless ascribed to her. She goes beyond the shadowy realms of the past to inhabit the very core of a future which is embodied within the suffering of a people who seek an alternative. |Dirk Wiemann / Parita Mukta| On Meera<ref name=dirkparita/><ref name=parita>Parita Mukta (1998), Upholding the Common Life: The Community of Mirabai, Oxford University Press, {{ISBN|978-0195643732}}, pages viii-x, 34-35</ref>}}
The continued influence of Meera, in part, has been her message of freedom, her resolve and right to pursue her devotion to deity Krishna and her spiritual beliefs as she felt drawn to despite her persecution.<ref name=dirkparita/><ref name=parita/> Her appeal and influence in Indian culture, writes Edwin Bryant, is from her emerging, through her legends and poems, as a person "who stands up for what is right and suffers bitterly for holding fast to her convictions, as other men and women have", yet she does so with a language of love, with words painting the "full range of emotions that mark love, whether between human beings or between human and divine".<ref>Edwin Bryant (2007), Krishna: A Sourcebook, Oxford University Press, {{ISBN|978-0195148923}}, page 245</ref>
==English versions== Aliston and Subramanian have published selections with English translation in India.<ref name="books.google.com">Mirabai, V. K. Subramanian, ''Mystic Songs of Meera'', Abhinav Publications, 2006 {{ISBN|81-7017-458-9}}, {{ISBN|978-81-7017-458-5}}, [https://books.google.com/books?id=dP-oekmHwWQC&pg=PA81&lpg=PP1&dq=meera&lr=&output=html]</ref><ref>Alston, A.J., ''The Devotional Poems of Mirabai'', Delhi 1980</ref> Schelling<ref>Schelling, Andrew, ''For Love of the Dark One: Songs of Mirabai'', Prescott, Arizona 1998</ref> and Landes-Levi<ref>Landes-Levi, Louise, ''Sweet On My Lips: The Love Poems of Mirabai'', New York 1997</ref> have offered anthologies in the USA. Snell<ref>Snell, Rupert. ''The Hindi Classical Tradition: A Braj Bhasa Reader'', London 1991, pp 39, 104–109.</ref> has presented parallel translations in his collection ''The Hindi Classical Tradition''. Sethi has selected poems which Mira composed presumably after she came in contact with Saint [[Ravidas]].<ref>Sethi, V.K.,''Mira: The Divine Lover'', Radha Soami Satsang Beas, Punjab 1988</ref> and Meera Pakeerah.
Some bhajans of Meera have been rendered into English by [[Robert Bly]] and [[Jane Hirshfield]] as ''Mirabai: Ecstatic Poems''.<ref>Bly, Robert / Hirshfield, Jane,''Mirabai: Ecstatic Poems'', Boston, Massachusetts 2004</ref>
==Popular culture== Composer [[John Harbison]] adapted Bly's translations for his ''Mirabai Songs.'' There is a documentary film ''A Few Things I Know About Her'' by Anjali Panjabi.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2002-10-04/news-interviews/27307288_1_film-maker-first-film-indian-panorama-section | work=The Times of India | title=Legend of Mira Bai retold by Anjali Panjabi | date=4 October 2002}}</ref> Two well-known films of her life have been made in India, ''[[Meera (1945 film)|Meera]]'' (1945), a [[Tamil language]] film starring [[M. S. Subbulakshmi]], and ''[[Meera (1979 film)|Meera]]'' a 1979 [[Standard Hindi|Hindi]] film by [[Gulzar (lyricist)|Gulzar]]. TV series, ''[[Meera (2009 TV series)|Meera]]'' (2009–2010) was also based on her life.
Meera Bai's life has been interpreted as a musical story in ''Meera—The Lover…'', a music album based on original compositions for some well known Meera bhajans, released 11 October 2009.<ref>[http://www.vandanavishwas.com Vandana Vishwas: Home<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>

{{nihongo|Heavensong Bow|天歌弓|Tenkakyu}} }}}} {{nihongo|'''Momiji'''|紅葉}} (meaning [[Acer palmatum|Japanese maple]]) is a fictional character from the ''[[Ninja Gaiden]]'' series of video games by [[Team Ninja]] and [[Koei Tecmo]]. She is a ninja [[shrine maiden]] and an apprentice and team mate of the series' protagonist [[Ryu Hayabusa]], who was introduced as a supporting playable character in 2008's [[action game]] ''[[Ninja Gaiden: Dragon Sword]]''. Momiji later returned in this role in ''[[Ninja Gaiden Sigma 2]]'' (including their ''Plus'' ports for the [[PlayStation Vita]]) and ''[[Ninja Gaiden 3: Razor's Edge]]'', and is also available in ''[[Dead or Alive 5 Ultimate]]''/''[[Dead or Alive 5 Last Round|Last Round]]'' and ''[[Warriors Orochi 3]] Hyper''/''Ultimate'', as well as in ''[[Dead or Alive Xtreme 3]]''. In most of her appearances, Momiji is voiced by [[Yūko Minaguchi]] in Japanese and by [[Kate Higgins]] in English. Her character has been generally well received by the series' fans and game critics ==Appearances== ===''Ninja Gaiden''=== Momiji was raised to be Hayabusa ninja clan's Dragon Shrine Maiden like her older sister Kureha who was [[Ryu Hayabusa|Ryu]]'s childhood friend.{{cite web|url=http://www.4gamer.net/games/087/G008776/20090608016/ |title=― 「NINJA GAIDEN Σ2」，公式サイトで日本語字幕付きのE3トレーラーを公開 |publisher=4gamer.net |date=2009-10-01 |accessdate=2014-06-08}} She is both a ''shinobi'' (ninja) and a ''[[miko]]'' (shamanistic shrine maiden){{cite web|url=http://www.4gamer.net/games/203/G020351/20130301039/|title=― 「NINJA GAIDEN 3: Razor's Edge」，プレイアブルヒロイン「かすみ」「紅葉」の"NINJA SKILLS"などをチェック。SmartGlassを使った機能も|date=2013-04-04|publisher=4gamer.net|accessdate=2014-06-08}} who was tasked with keeping the ancient relics passed down the Hayabusa village from the ancient Dragon Lineage and carrying out the Shrine Maiden's rites and rituals to purify the world of evil forces. Among the relics that the maidens were tasked with guarding is the Eye of the Dragon, a jewel said to contain the souls of the ancient Dragons. Kureha was killed when the village was attacked in 2004's ''[[Ninja Gaiden (2004 video game)|Ninja Gaiden]]'' and the devastated Momiji began training under Ryu as a precaution, becoming a skilled [[kunoichi]] along with her shrine maiden duties and abilities.{{cite web|url=http://www.destructoid.com/ninja-gaiden-sigma-2-plus-on-vita-new-screens-details-244722.phtml |title=Ninja Gaiden Sigma 2 Plus on Vita: New screens, details |publisher=Destructoid |date= |accessdate=2014-06-08}} Since then she supports and follows her master whenever he comes around. Momiji is a very gentle and caring young woman who is seen as an older sister figure by all of the village's children,{{cite web|url=http://teamninja-studio.com/ng3re/us/characters.htm#tab8 |title=NINJA GAIDEN 3: Razor's Edge | Official Site | TECMO KOEI America |publisher=Teamninja-studio.com |date= |accessdate=2014-06-08}} including the boy Sanji. Like her mentor Ryu Hayabusa, Momiji trains extensively to become one of the deadliest warriors in the Hayabusa village. In ''[[Ninja Gaiden: Dragon Sword]]'', Momiji is normally playable only in the game's first chapter, but it is possible to play her through the entire game after [[Unlockable (gaming)|unlocking]] the special difficulty setting "The Way of Kunoichi",{{cite web|url=http://www.gamerevolution.com/cheats/ng-dragon-sword |title=Ninja Gaiden Dragon Sword Cheats, Hints, and Cheat Codes |publisher=Gamerevolution.com |date= |accessdate=2014-06-17}}{{cite web|url=http://www.cheatcc.com/ds/ninjagaidendragonswordcheatscodes.html |title=Ninja Gaiden: Dragon Sword Cheats, Codes, Cheat Codes, Walkthrough, Guide, FAQ, Unlockables for Nintendo DS |publisher=Cheatcc.com |date=2014-06-13 |accessdate=2014-06-17}} which becomes accessible if the player manages to win the unfair [[Boss (video gaming)|boss]] fight at the end Momiji's chapter.{{cite web|url=http://www.hardcoregaming101.net/ninjagaiden/ninjagaiden6.htm |title=Ninja Gaiden |publisher=Hardcoregaming101.net |date= |accessdate=2015-04-17}} After her session of training with Ryu, Momiji stays behind to pick flowers for Kureha's grave where she is attacked by the Black Spider clan and eventually captured by the fiendish Red Dragon. She is interrogated by Black Spider's Obaba for the Eye of the Dragon but turns out she managed to fuse the jewel into her soul, preventing Obaba from killing her. The Fiends' leader Ishtaros plans to use the captive Momiji to lure Ryu and kill him. During the battle between Ryu and Ishtaros at the Gates of Hell, Ryu is overwhelmed by the Dark Dragonstones' power but the ghost of Kureha appears and draws out Momiji's soul. Together they release the Eye and imbue the Dragon Sword with its power, allowing it to become the True Dragon Sword that Ryu uses to defeat Ishtaros. Nicchae, the Greater Fiend of Destruction and Ishtaros's twin, appears and takes Momiji, Ishtaros' body and the eight Dark Dragonstones deeper into Hell in an attempt to reawaken the Vigoor Emperor. Nicchae's plan ends in failure as the Dark Dragon consumes the Emperor and Ishtaros before bursting forth to threaten the world once again. Ryu defeats the Dark Dragon with the True Dragon Sword, and Momiji is finally rescued. Afterwards, Momiji mourns Kureha alongside the children of the village and makes a vow at Kureha's grave to become stronger so she can defend herself and the village. She leaves Ryu a letter as she departs to train in her travels. Momiji returns as a playable character in ''[[Ninja Gaiden Sigma 2]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.shacknews.com/article/57858/ninja-gaiden-sigma-2-trailer |title=Ninja Gaiden Sigma 2 Trailer: Fancy Female Ninjas - Video Game News, Videos and File Downloads for PC and Console Games at |publisher=Shacknews.com |date= |accessdate=2014-06-08}} While Ryu is away at [[Tokyo]], the Hayabusa village is invaded once again by the Black Spider clan. As Jo battles Genshin, Momji rallies the Hayabusa ninjas to protect the rest of the villagers. Ryu later returns to the village and repels the invasion, killing almost all the invading Black Spider ninjas. Momiji soon realizes that Sanji has been taken captive, prompting her to go rescue him. As she travels to Tokyo, she encounters one of the Tengu Brothers and soundly defeats him. This leads her to Sanji, who is being held prisoner by both brothers. After her victorious battle, she reassures Sanji that she will always look out for him until he becomes a master ninja. As they return home, they are unknowingly saved by Muramasa, who kills a Black Spider ninja who is about to shoot an arrow at them. Momiji is also featured in the spin-off title ''ZEN Pinball: Ninja Gaiden Sigma 2''.{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/playstation-3/zen-pinball-ninja-gaiden-sigma-2 |title=ZEN Pinball: Ninja Gaiden Sigma 2 for PlayStation 3 Reviews |publisher=Metacritic |date=2010-01-15 |accessdate=2014-06-08}} In ''[[Ninja Gaiden 3]]'', after Sanji finds Ryu unconscious outside and brings him to Momiji, she watches over him and helps him recover. During his journey to find his father in the shrine, she assists him in dealing with the Grip of Murder curse while helping him defeat the Black Spider ninja clan. Whenever the curse almost takes complete control over Ryu, Momiji uses her power to protect his mind and help him regain his senses. As they get near to the shrine, they are attacked by Obaba, but they manage to defeat her. Near the end of the battle, Momiji is knocked unconscious by Obaba, but Ryu manages to save her and brings her to the shrine to be taken care of by his father. When Canna attacks Tokyo as the Goddess and Ryu begins to become overwhelmed by Fiends, Momiji and Jo arrive just in time to save him. She gives her master the Eye of the Dragon before he departs, leaving her and his father to fight off the surrounding foes. Momiji became playable again in the ''NG3'' update ''[[Ninja Gaiden 3: Razor's Edge]]''.{{cite web |url=http://gamevideos.1up.com/video/id/25673 |title=Ninja Gaiden Sigma 2 Ayane/Momiji Co-Op Gameplay HD Video from GameVideos |publisher=Gamevideos.1up.com |date= |accessdate=2014-06-08 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120711030039/http://gamevideos.1up.com/video/id/25673 |archivedate=2012-07-11 |df= }} She makes an appearance in the spin-off game ''[[Yaiba: Ninja Gaiden Z]]'',{{cite web|url=http://www.4gamer.net/games/184/G018408/20140131073/ |title=「YAIBA: NINJA GAIDEN Z」，最新ムービー「OUTBREAK #5」「プレイ上のご注意」や，B級映画風ポスターなど新たなビジュアルが公開 |publisher=4Gamer.net |date=2014-03-27 |accessdate=2014-06-08}} as an ally and love interest of Ryu, who is an antagonist in the game. She arrives to give the Eye of the Dragon to him, and then Ryu saves her from peril. ===Other appearances=== In the fighting games ''[[Dead or Alive 5 Ultimate]]'' and ''[[Dead or Alive 5 Last Round]]'', Momiji joins the DOA tournament in order to put what she has learned to the test.{{cite web|url=http://teamninja-studio.com/doa5/ultimate/us/home.html#characters |title=DEAD OR ALIVE 5 Ultimate Official Site |publisher=Teamninja-studio.com |date= |accessdate=2014-06-10}} She is one of the nine playable female characters in the ''DOA'' sport spin-off title ''[[Dead or Alive Xtreme 3]]''.{{cite web|title="第一回 DOAX3総選挙 〜ザック島行きチケット争奪戦〜".|url=https://www.gamecity.ne.jp/doax3/vote_result.html|website=Gamecity.ne.jp|accessdate=2015-09-19}} Momiji makes playable appearances in the [[Wii U]] edition of ''[[Warriors Orochi 3]]'' (''Warriors Orochi 3 Hyper''{{cite web|url=http://www.siliconera.com/2012/10/04/warriors-orochi-3-hyper-adds-shennong-and-ninja-gaidens-momiji/ |title=Warriors Orochi 3 Hyper Adds Shennong And Ninja Gaiden's Momiji |publisher=Siliconera |date=2012-10-04 |accessdate=2014-06-08}}), including in the game's duel mode,{{cite web|url=http://www.siliconera.com/2012/10/31/rachel-and-momiji-show-off-their-moves-in-warriors-orochi-3-hyper-videos/ |title=Rachel And Momiji Show Off Their Moves In Warriors Orochi 3 Hyper Videos |publisher=Siliconera |date=2012-10-31 |accessdate=2013-09-10}} and later in ''Warriors Orochi 3 Ultimate''. Previously she has made an unplayable guest appearance in the ''Warriors'' series in ''[[Dynasty Warriors: Strikeforce]]'' for the [[PlayStation 3]],{{cite web|last=Usher |first=William |url=http://www.cinemablend.com/games/Dynasty-Warriors-StrikeForce-Momiji-Screenshots-22362.html |title=Dynasty Warriors StrikeForce Momiji Screenshots |publisher=Cinemablend |date=2010-01-20 |accessdate=2016-07-15}} where she gives a series of quests to the player character who can earn the right to wield her Heavenly Dragon Naginata in battle. ==Design and promotion== [[File:Momiiji DS.png|thumb|left|upright|Mariko Hirokane's original design of the character in ''[[Ninja Gaiden: Dragon Sword]]'']] {{quote box|quote=She's really [[Kawaii|cute]]. Kasumi and Ayane of course are beautiful girls that are done in three dimensions, right? But this new character named Momiji is done through 2D illustrations. But I think that the sense of beauty that you get from seeing her in the illustrations is equal to Kasumi. But this is the first time I've said anything like this since we started [[Team Ninja]]. |source=—Team Ninja head [[Tomonobu Itagaki]] in 2007{{cite web|url=http://archive.videogamesdaily.com/features/teamninja_iv_oct07_p3.asp |title=Video Games Daily | Ninja Gaiden 2 & Ninja Gaiden DS - The Essential Interview (Page 3) |publisher=Archive.videogamesdaily.com |date=2007-10-25 |accessdate=2015-07-17}}|width=30%}} The character was originally designed for ''Ninja Gaiden: Dragon Sword'' by Mariko Hirokane,{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/person/mariko-hirokane?filter-options=games |title=Mariko Hirokane Profile |publisher=Metacritic |date= |accessdate=2014-06-08}} whose work on the game was her professional debut{{cite web|url=http://www.gamesradar.com/ninja-gaiden-dragon-sword-interview/ |title=Ninja Gaiden: Dragon Sword interview |publisher=GamesRadar |date=2008-01-15 |accessdate=2014-06-08}} (she also later worked as a concept artist for ''Dead or Alive 5''[http://teamninja-studio.com/doa5/pdf/PS3_DOA5_us.pdf ONLINE PASS - Team NINJA Studio]). ''Dragon Sword'' producer and ''Ninja Gaiden'' ''Sigma 2'' producer and director Yosuke Hayashi, who considers Momiji his "very own" character,{{cite web|url=http://archive.videogamesdaily.com/features/interview-new-team-ninja-head-yosuke-hayashi-p1.asp |title=Video Games Daily | Interview: New Team Ninja Head Yosuke Hayashi |publisher=Archive.videogamesdaily.com |date=2009-05-15 |accessdate=2014-06-08}} stated his ''Sigma 2'' design priorities as "How much sexier can a female ninja get?"{{cite web|url=http://blog.us.playstation.com/2009/07/02/ninja-gaiden-sigma-2-challenge/ |title=Ninja Gaiden Sigma 2 Challenge – PlayStation.Blog |publisher=Blog.us.playstation.com |date= |accessdate=2014-06-08}} He said she was the "definitively" the most difficult of the ''Sigma 2'' heroes to create for this game: "Honestly, there were no clear answers to questions like what she would look like as high-res model, what sort of weapon she would use, and what her abilities were. All our staff had different ideas about her, but I think it came together well in the end, and we were able bring her personality to life." Hayashi also said he had originally rejected the idea of making [[Ayane (Dead or Alive)|Ayane]] (from ''Dead or Alive'') and Momiji playable in the original version of ''Ninja Gaiden 3'' as he wanted to focus on Ryu.{{cite web|url=http://www.siliconera.com/2011/07/14/yosuke-hayashi-wants-players-to-feel-each-katana-slicein-ninja-gaiden-3/ |title=Yosuke Hayashi Wants Players To Feel Each Katana Slice In Ninja Gaiden 3 |publisher=Siliconera |date=2011-07-14 |accessdate=2014-06-08}} Momiji is a tall, young girl with [[Eye color#Amber|amber eyes]] and long black hair tied in a ponytail. Ninja Gaiden Sigma 2 – hands-on |publisher=GamesRadar |date=2009-09-02 |accessdate=2014-06-08}} Despite Momiji's use of bow and arrows,{{cite web|last=Yoon |first=Andrew |url=http://www.joystiq.com/2009/07/03/watch-sigma-2-exclusive-momoji-slash-up-some-ninjas/ |title=Watch Sigma 2-exclusive Momiji slash up some ninjas |publisher=Joystiq |date=2009-07-03 |accessdate=2014-06-08}} ''[[PC Magazine]]'' opined that a particular problem with Momiji in the game is that she has "no effective quick projectile," and so the players have "to rely on her jumping abilities and Ultimate Techniques to create some breathing room."{{cite web|last=Zamora |first=Gabriel |url=https://www.pcmag.com/article2/0,2817,2457509,00.asp |title=Ninja Gaiden 4 Wishlist |publisher=PCMag.com |date=2014-05-05 |accessdate=2014-06-08}} Momiji's breasts in the game can be manipulated with the motion sensor of the [[Sixaxis]] controller.{{cite web|url=http://www.kotaku.jp/2009/09/07_ninjagaiden2_sixaxis.html |title=胸がハズむ『NINJA GAIDEN Σ2』 一緒にユサユサしてみよう！ ｜ コタク・ジャパン |publisher=Kotaku.jp |date= |accessdate=2014-06-08}}{{cite web|author=Logan Westbrook |url=http://www.escapistmagazine.com/news/view/94494-Ninja-Gaiden-2-to-Support-Sixaxis-for-T-A |title=Ninja Gaiden 2 to Support Sixaxis for T&A | The Escapist |publisher=Escapistmagazine.com |date= |accessdate=2014-06-10}} In ''Ninja Gaiden 3: Razor's Edge'', she was made simultaneously available in an update for the Wii U version{{cite web|url=http://www.computerandvideogames.com/379199/ninja-gaiden-3-wii-u-trailer-shows-momiji-in-action/ |title=Ninja Gaiden 3 Wii U trailer shows Momiji in action - Video Game News, Videos and File Downloads for PC and Console Games at |publisher=Shacknews.com |date= |accessdate=2014-06-08}} She can be played in Chapter Challenge mode and Ninja Trials co-op mode.{{cite web|url=http://blog.eu.playstation.com/2013/02/07/ninja-gaiden-3-razors-edge-coming-soon-to-playstation-3/ |title=Ninja Gaiden 3: Razor's Edge coming soon to PlayStation 3 - PlayStation.Blog.Europe |publisher=Blog.eu.playstation.com |date= |accessdate=2014-06-08}} Her new skills include a long-range naginata attack.{{cite web|url=http://www.computerandvideogames.com/397072/ninja-gaiden-3-razors-edge-exclusive-content-detailed/ |title=Ninja Gaiden 3: Razor's Edge exclusive content detailed - CVG |publisher=Computerandvideogames.com |date=2013-03-21 |accessdate=2014-06-08}} ''[[X-One|X360]]'' judged all the "girls" of the game as "just as deadly" as Ryu.''X360 Magazine UK'' issue 97, page 75. In ''Dead or Alive 5 Ultimate'', Momiji is still an agile character, retaining her unique double jump move from the ''Ninja Gaiden'' series.{{cite web|url=http://www.siliconera.com/2013/06/13/dead-or-alive-5-ultimate-momiji-has-a-double-jump-rachel-is-a-heavy-hitter/ |title=Dead Or Alive 5 Ultimate Momiji Has A Double Jump, Rachel Is A Heavy Hitter |publisher=Siliconera |date=2013-06-13 |accessdate=2013-09-10}} Like Kasumi, Momiji is able to teleport, but her style is completely different with a relatively high learning curve.{{cite web|url=http://www.siliconera.com/2013/10/06/finding-character-right-dead-alive-5-ultimate/ |title=Finding Which Character Was Right For Me In Dead or Alive 5 Ultimate |publisher=Siliconera |date=2013-10-06 |accessdate=2014-06-08}} [[NowGamer]] reported that in ''DOA5U'' she has "a few aerial mix-ups and even a 360 air-throw for those who want a slightly more challenging character to master." ==Reception== The character was mostly well received, in part due to her [[sex appeal]].{{cite web|author=Gerasimos Manolatos |url=http://www.maxim.com/gaming/maxims-weekend-game-room-go-ninja-go-ninja-go |title=Maxim's Weekend Game Room: Go Ninja Go Ninja Go |publisher=Maxim |date= |accessdate=2014-06-08}}{{cite web|url=http://www.gamebug.com.au/2013/08/29/50-sexiest-video-game-babes/5/ |title=50 Hottest Video Game Babes of All Time | Gamebug - Part 5 |publisher=Gamebug |date=2013-08-29 |accessdate=2014-06-08}}{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.4gamer.net/games/134/G013470/20121116062/ |title=― 薙刀の達人「紅葉」を収録した「Ninja Gaiden 3: Razor's Edge」の最新トレイラーが公開に。セクシーなコスチュームの数々もじっくりチェック |website=4gamer.net |date=2012-12-08 |accessdate=2016-02-06}} GameSpot's Luke Anderson wrote that in ''Ninja Gaiden Sigma 2'' "Momiji certainly looks the part in a Tecmo game, and with that sort of getup, she's certain to send pulses racing." Commenting on her more detailed appearance in ''Sigma 2'' in comparison to this in ''Dragon Sword'', Michael McWhertor of [[Kotaku]] wrote that "all that smooth upper thigh rendered by the [[Cell (microprocessor)|Cell]] processor" would be one of the main selling points of the game;{{cite web|url=http://kotaku.com/5306664/ninja-gaiden-sigma-2s-momiji-in-action |title=Ninja Gaiden Sigma 2's Momiji In Action |publisher=Kotaku.com |date= |accessdate=2014-06-08}} ''[[Play (UK magazine)|PLAY]]'' later placed her Momiji ''Sigma 2'' as third on their 2010 list of top "side-boobs" in games.{{cite web|url=http://www.play-mag.co.uk/features/top-10-side-boobs-in-games/ |title=Top 10 side-boobs in games | PLAY Magazine |publisher=Play-mag.co.uk |date=2010-11-22 |accessdate=2013-09-05}} Justin Towell of GamesRadar opined Momiji adds "some welcome variety to the hack 'n' slash gameplay" of ''Sigma 2'' and stated a hope she would appear in ''[[Dead or Alive 5]]'' "and our Sexy Fan Art gallery too."{{cite web|url=http://www.gamesradar.com/ninja-gaiden-sigma-2-cuts-back-on-gore/ |title=Ninja Gaiden Sigma 2 cuts back on gore |publisher=GamesRadar |date=2009-06-30 |accessdate=2014-06-08}} [[Prima Games]] called Momiji a ''Ninja Gaiden'' fan favorite{{cite web|url=http://www.primagames.com/games/dead-or-alive-5/strategy/dead-or-alive-5-ultimate-momiji-tips |title=Dead or Alive 5 Ultimate - Momiji Tips | Strategy |publisher=Primagames.com |date=2012-09-25 |accessdate=2014-06-10}} and ''PSX Extreme'' compared her to ''[[Soul (series)|Soulcalibur]]'''s [[Taki (Soulcalibur)|Taki]] as similar in her figure and design.''PSX Extreme'' issue 141 (05/2009), page 6. She was ranked as the 31st best looking game girl by [[GameHall]]'s Portal PlayGame in 2014{{cite web|url=http://portalplaygame.com/top-100-as-personagens-mais-gatas-dos-games/ |title=TOP 100 – As Personagens mais gatas dos games | Portal Play Game |publisher=Web.archive.org |date=2015-01-23 |accessdate=2015-08-27 |deadurl=unfit |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150123234148/http://portalplaygame.com/top-100-as-personagens-mais-gatas-dos-games/ |archivedate=January 23, 2015 }} and has been consistently voted the ''DOA'' series' eight most popular female character in Japan in the publisher [[Koei Tecmo]]'s own polls in both 2014 and 2015.{{cite web|url=http://www.gamecity.ne.jp/doa5/lastround/vote/index.html|title=DEAD OR ALIVE 5 Last Round タペストリー キャラ投票|publisher=Gamecity.ne.jp|accessdate=24 December 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://www.destructoid.com/dead-or-alive-xtreme-3-coming-to-playstation-vr-311600.phtml|title=Dead or Alive Xtreme 3 coming to PlayStation VR|date=2015-09-19|website=Destructoid.com|accessdate=2016-02-06}} [[Dave Halverson]] from ''[[Play (U.S. magazine)|play]]'' wanted to see ''Ninja Gaiden'' "back to its action-platforming roots with Momiji as the lead."{{Cite journal|last=|first=|date=October 2009|title=Ninja Gaiden Sigma 2: United they stand|url=|journal=play|publisher=Fusion Pub|volume=94|pages=|via=}} NowGamer's Ryan King called Momiji "the most interesting addition" to ''Dead or Alive 5 Ultimate''{{cite web|url=http://www.nowgamer.com/ps3/ps3-reviews/2066314/dead_or_alive_5_ultimate_review.html |title=Dead Or Alive 5 Ultimate Review |publisher=NowGamer |date=2013-09-03 |accessdate=2013-09-10}} and GamesRadar's Mike Reparaz included her appearance in ''Dynasty Warriors: Strikeforce'' among the "awesome character cameos".{{cite web|url=http://www.gamesradar.com/55-awesome-character-cameos/?page=3 |title=Page 3 - 55 awesome character cameos |publisher=GamesRadar |date=2010-05-01 |accessdate=2014-06-08}} Craig Harris of [[IGN]] praised the "great" way of how she was used in the tutorial chapter in ''Dragon Sword'',{{cite web|url=http://uk.ign.com/articles/2008/03/07/ninja-gaiden-dragon-sword-review |title=Ninja Gaiden Dragon Sword Review - IGN |publisher=Uk.ign.com |date= |accessdate=2014-06-08}} and IGN's Ryan Clements wrote that the "beautiful Momiji...will add yet another layer of gameplay to ''Sigma 2'' that elevates the experience beyond the 360 version;"{{cite web|last=Clements |first=Ryan |url=http://uk.ign.com/articles/2009/03/24/gdc-09-ninja-gaiden-sigma-2-officially-detailed |title=GDC 09: Ninja Gaiden Sigma 2 Officially Detailed - IGN |publisher=Uk.ign.com |date=2009-03-24 |accessdate=2014-06-08}} the game's review by ''PLAY'' opined her stages, albeit short, "genuinely enhance ''Ninja Gaiden Sigma 2 Plus''’s core story."''Play UK'' issue 230, page 70. Speaking of different character and the change in gameplay it brings, [[Sony Computer Entertainment|SCEA]]'s Jeff Rubenstein said, "personally, I was a fan of Momiji and her halberd weapon in ''NGS2''."{{cite web|url=http://blog.eu.playstation.com/2011/12/09/team-ninja-details-ninja-gaiden-3-multiplayer-ninja-gaiden-sigma-for-ps-vita/ |title=Team Ninja Details Ninja Gaiden 3 Multiplayer, Ninja Gaiden Sigma+ For PS Vita - PlayStation.Blog.Europe |publisher=Blog.eu.playstation.com |date= |accessdate=2014-06-08}} On the other hand, Gabriel Zamor of ''PC Magazine'' singled her out while writing about how "frustrating experience" using female characters can be for the players in the ''Ninja Gaiden'' series as it can force "a significant play-style change on them." IGN's Vince Ingenito singled out Momiji and [[Nyotengu]] as the best new characters of ''DOA5'', writing: "Momiji's style, while certainly reminiscent of the many ninjas of the cast, adds enough flaming flourishes and impressive acrobatics to set her apart. Watching the two of them face off falls somewhere between late-night Hong Kong [[wire-fu]] and a live-action ''[[Avatar: The Last Airbender|Avatar]]'' fan-fic, in the best possible way."{{cite web|author=|url=http://uk.ign.com/articles/2015/02/24/dead-or-alive-5-last-round-review |title=Dead or Alive 5: Last Round Review - IGN |publisher=Uk.ign.com |date=2015-02-23 |accessdate=2015-08-27}} GamesRadar's Brett Elston opined she looks "a lot more family friendly" than the characters from the previous ''Ninja Gaiden'' games even as ''play'' noted how "astonishingly" Momiji dressed conservatively in ''Dragon Sword'',{{Cite journal|last=|first=|date=November 2007|title=Ninja Gaiden: Dragon's Sword|url=|journal=play|publisher=Fusion Pub|volume=71|pages=106|via=}} even as Earnest Cavalli of ''[[The Escapist (magazine)|The Escapist]]'' called her a "hilariously stereotypical" example of an "overtly sexualized Japanese woman."{{cite web|first=Earnest | last=Cavalli |url=http://www.escapistmagazine.com/news/view/123884-Yet-Another-Busty-Ninja-Joins-Dead-Or-Alive-5-Ultimate |title=Yet Another Busty Ninja Joins Dead Or Alive 5 Ultimate | The Escapist |publisher=Escapistmagazine.com |date= |accessdate=2014-06-08}} VideoGamer.com noted her for a "class and charm,"{{cite web|url=http://www.videogamer.com/videos/ninja_gaiden_3_razors_edge_momiji_trailer.html |title=Ninja Gaiden 3: Razor's Edge: Momiji Trailer - Game Trailers |publisher=VideoGamer.com |date=2012-11-19 |accessdate=2014-06-08}} and GameSpot's Kevin VanOrd wrote he "cringed" when he found a poem written by Ryu "in which he professes his adoration of Momiji and refers to his own manhood as a 'wee-wee'" in one of the toilet humour jokes in ''Ninja Gaiden Z''.{{cite web|author=Kevin VanOrd |url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/how-i-learned-to-like-yaiba-ninja-gaiden-z/1100-6416670/ |title=How I Learned to Like Yaiba: Ninja Gaiden Z |publisher=GameSpot |date=2013-12-12 |accessdate=2014-06-08}} Despite warnings from Team Ninja to not do it or no more ''Dead or Alive'' games will be released for the PC, [[Modding|modders]] quickly released a topless version of Momiji in ''Last Round''.{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.vcpost.com/articles/54252/20150401/dead-alive-5-pc-update-team-ninja-gets-flak-incomplete-game-launch-modders-release-topless-female-mods.htm |title=‘Dead or Alive 5’ PC Update to feature topless mods of voluptuous female fighters: Team Ninja gets flak from incomplete ‘Last Round’ launch : Trending News : Venture Capital Post |publisher=Vcpost.com |date=2015-04-01 |accessdate=2015-07-09}}{{cite web|author=Nachiket Mhatre |url=http://www.ibtimes.com.au/pc-modders-defy-team-ninjas-threats-release-nude-mods-dead-or-alive-5-last-round-1437811 |title=PC Modders Defy Team Ninja's Threats, Release Nude Mods For 'Dead Or Alive 5 Last Round' |publisher=Ibtimes.com.au |date= |accessdate=2015-07-09}}{{cite web|author=Tabitha Dickerson |url=https://www.lewdgamer.com/2015/03/31/dead-or-alive-5-last-round-momiji-topless-mod |title=Dead or Alive 5 Last Round - Momiji Topless Mod |publisher=Lewdgamer.com |date=2015-03-31 |accessdate=2015-07-09}} ==See also== {{Commons category inline|Momiji (Ninja Gaiden)}} *[[Ninja in popular culture]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Dead or Alive series}} {{Ninja Gaiden series}} [[Category:Dead or Alive (series) characters]] [[Category:Female characters in video games]] [[Category:Fictional archers]] [[Category:Fictional blade and dart-throwers]] [[Category:Fictional exorcists]] [[Category:Fictional female ninja]] [[Category:Fictional female religious workers]] [[Category:Fictional pole and spear fighters]] [[Category:Fictional Japanese people in video games]] [[Category:Fictional Ninjutsu practitioners]] [[Category:Fictional jujutsuka]] [[Category:Fictional shamans]] [[Category:Fictional swordsmen]] [[Category:Ninja characters in video games]] [[Category:Ninja Gaiden characters]] [[Category:Religious worker characters in video games]] [[Category:Video game characters in comics]] [[Category:Video game characters introduced in 2008]] [[Category:Video game characters who can move at superhuman speeds]] [[Category:Video game characters who can teleport]] [[Category:Video game characters who use magic]] [[Category:Video game sidekicks]] [[Category:Woman soldier and warrior characters in video games]]
